summary: A Law360 news article from June 17, 2021, reporting that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney complained to a Manhattan federal judge about her jail conditions, including raw sewage in her cell and guards listening to privileged conversations, which she claims hinders her ability to defend against child sex-trafficking charges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in a child sex-trafficking case whose attorney is complaining about her jail conditions, including raw sewage and guards listening to privileged conversations.

events.title: Attorney's complaint about Maxwell's jail conditions
events.description: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys sent a letter to a Manhattan federal judge complaining that Maxwell cannot defend herself due to raw sewage in her cell and federal prison guards listening in on her privileged conversations.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney complained to a federal judge about her jail conditions in June 2021.
The complaint cited raw sewage in Maxwell's cell as a hindrance to her defense.
The complaint also alleged federal prison guards were listening in on Maxwell's privileged conversations.
Maxwell was facing child sex-trafficking charges at the time.
The attorney argued these conditions prevented Maxwell from properly defending herself.
